text:
Hello everyone!

Ever felt the need for a platform to express your thoughts, to be heard and to spark change, no matter how small?

Enter Awaaz, the dynamic nucleus of student media at IIT Kharagpur. We're seeking Junior as well as Senior Reporters to champion free speech and embody the spirit of journalism.

Picture a space where your opinions resonate freely and your concerns become agents of change. Awaaz is that realm—a canvas where the art of constructive journalism meets the essence of freedom.

No prerequisites—just the essence of your skills in the spotlight. Feel the energy, catch the vibe, and be part of the Awaaz.

See you there!

Venue: F-131 and F-132 (Main Building)
Date: 6th, 7th, and 8th October 2023
Time: 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM

Register: https://forms.gle/k4KFsxCdF3DWubV59

text:
“The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.” - Mahatma Gandhi

Gandhiji led a life dedicated to the service of humanity. His unwavering commitment to truth, non-violence, and justice inspired millions to join the fight for India's independence. His principles continue to guide us, reminding us of the power of moral strength and civil disobedience in the face of adversity.
As we celebrate Gandhi Jayanti, let us pay homage to the man who led India to freedom and inspired movements for justice and equality worldwide. Let us pledge to live by his principles of truth, non-violence, and unity, working together to create a world that reflects the dreams and aspirations of the Mahatma. In doing so, we honor his memory and continue the legacy of the Father of the Nation.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur pays tribute in his name and hopes that his exemplary life can be the guiding light far and beyond.

text:
Hey there! We know it's been a long wait, but we are back with another story, another tale of triumph. Consider this- you are on a ship that isn't bound for any destination in particular but has been equipped with state-of-the-art equipments, maps, tracking devices and whatnot. Sounds familiar? Guess that's most of our lives, plodding our way through an education system that gives us all possible tools but leaves the part of teaching us where to use them to us (destiny). Kapish Saraf, an alumnus of IIT KGP and recipient of this year’s Young Alumni Achiever's Award, made a similar miscalculation early on in his life, but today, is building KidEx Ventures- a startup that focuses on introducing experiential learning for school children and thus equips them to make informed choices. Today's children are tomorrow's youth and future in the making, and Kapish is making an immeasurable impact where it matters.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur, thanks, Kapish, for taking out the time to speak to us. Check out our Interview with him, where we discuss his journey from IIT KGP to IIM Calcutta to BCG and beyond, his views on NEP 2020, leadership and life in general.
Link: https://awaaziitkgp.com/young-alumni-achiever-award-2023-mr-kapish-saraf/

text:
Mediclaim Medical Bill Portal Now Active on ERP

We would like to inform all students about the recent implementation of the Mediclaim Medical Bill Portal on the ERP system. This update aims to simplify and enhance the process of claiming medical expenses for our students.

How to Use the Mediclaim Medical Bill Portal:
To make the most of this new feature, please follow these step-by-step instructions:
1. ClickApply For Final Medical Bill, a screen will appear, enter data and then Click SAVE DATA
2. Then, Click Details a new screen will appear
3. For Doctor's fee, Click Add New Row in Consultation Details, a modal will open. Enter data then Click SAVE DATA
4. For Test details, Click Add new row in Test Details
5. For Medicine, Click Add New row in Medicine and Accessories Details. For long medicine list you can enter total amount against multiple voucher in a single row
6. For Bed charges Click Add New Row in Accommodation Details
7. If everything is right, Click Final Submit
8. In the Action area of that particular request, there are two button. You can edit request by clicking EDIT Button or delete any row by clicking Delete Button till you Click the Final Submit.

**Once final submit, you cannot edit any more**

9. Then Print Button will appear in the Action area. Take printout, sign it and submit it to B C Roy Technology Hospital with supporting document.

This streamlined process ensures that your medical expenses are efficiently reimbursed. Make sure to follow these steps carefully to navigate the Mediclaim Medical Bill Portal successfully.

We would like to inform all students about the recent implementation of the Mediclaim Medical Bill Portal on the ERP system. This update aims to simplify and enhance the process of claiming medical expenses for our students.

How to Use the Mediclaim Medical Bill Portal:
To make the most of this new feature, please follow these step-by-step instructions:
1. ClickApply For Final Medical Bill, a screen will appear, enter data and then Click SAVE DATA
2. Then, Click Details a new screen will appear
3. For Doctor's fee, Click Add New Row in Consultation Details, a modal will open. Enter data then Click SAVE DATA
4. For Test details, Click Add new row in Test Details
5. For Medicine, Click Add New row in Medicine and Accessories Details. For long medicine list you can enter total amount against multiple voucher in a single row
6. For Bed charges Click Add New Row in Accommodation Details
7. If everything is right, Click Final Submit
8. In the Action area of that particular request, there are two button. You can edit request by clicking EDIT Button or delete any row by clicking Delete Button till you Click the Final Submit.

**Once final submit, you cannot edit any more**

9. Then Print Button will appear in the Action area. Take printout, sign it and submit it to B C Roy Technology Hospital with supporting document.

This streamlined process ensures that your medical expenses are efficiently reimbursed. Make sure to follow these steps carefully to navigate the Mediclaim Medical Bill Portal successfully.

text:
The Second Athletics Championship occurred on 9 September 2023 and 10 September 2023 at Jnan Ghosh Stadium. On 9 September 2023, 8:00 am, Prof. Ajay Kumar Singh, President of the Technology Students' Gymkhana and the Chairman of the meet, Honorable Registrar Capt. Amit Jain and Sports official Mr. Soumen Mondal inspected the contingents from various institutions and declared the championship open. There were 17 teams across the district competing in 4 categories: Under 16 men and women, Under 23 men and women. 19 track and field events were scheduled in the 2 days, a new event being the 4x100m Mixed relay in the Under 23 men and women category, and were conducted successfully.

The Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur secured the overall championship title at the athletics competition. In the U-16 girls' category, the championship title was claimed by the Vivekananda Track and Field Coaching Centre for Excellence. Meanwhile, in the U-16 boys', the championship title went to the Athletics Coaching Centre in Midnapore. In the U-23 women's category, the championship title was earned by Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur Team A, while in the U-23 men's category, the championship title was also secured by Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur Team A.

Sports extend beyond mere victory or defeat; they encapsulate a collective journey, a mutual competition that embodies values fostering our personal growth. Primarily, our most profound rivalry takes place within ourselves, urging us to be our very best.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the medal winners for their achievements and appreciates the hard work and efforts of every athlete who contributed to their team.

text:
निज भाषा उन्नति अहै, सब उन्नति को मूल,
बिन निज भाषा-ज्ञान के, मिटत न हिय को सूल।
~ भारतेन्दु हरिश्चन्द्र

हिंदी भाषा और बाकी सारी भारतीय भाषाओं ने मिलकर भारत की सांस्कृतिक विविधता को आगे ले जाने में बहुत बड़ा योगदान दिया है। हिंदी हमारे देश के स्वतंत्रता संग्राम के समय से राष्ट्रीय एकता और अस्मिता का प्रभावी व शक्तिशाली माध्यम रही है। इसकी सबस सुंदर शक्ति इसकी सरलता, सुभोधता और स्वीकार्यता है जो हमारे पारम्‍परिक ज्ञान, प्राचीन सभ्‍यता और आधुनिक प्रगति के बीच एक सेतु है।

आज यानी 14 सितम्बर, 1949 के दिन संविधान सभा ने हिंदी को संघ की राजभाषा के रूप में स्वीकार किया था। तत्पश्तात हिन्दी के उपयोग को प्रचलित करने के लिए साल 1953 के उपरांत हर साल 14 सितंबर को हिन्दी दिवस मनाया जाता है। भारत मे हर क्षेत्र, जाति एवं धर्म के लोग रहतें हैँ। उनमे एकता और अखंडता की भावना बनाये रखने का कार्य देवनागरी लिपि मे लिखित हिंदी भाषा करती है।

आवाज़, भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान खड़गपुर की ओर से आप सभी को हिंदी दिवस की सहृदयपूर्ण शुभकामनाएं।

My own language is development, the root of all progress,
Without own language-knowledge, the principles cannot be erased.
~ Bharatendu Harishchandra

Hindi language and all other Indian languages together have contributed a huge contribution in taking India's cultural diversity forward. Hindi has been an effective and powerful medium of national unity and innocence since our country's freedom struggle. Its most beautiful power is its simplicity, aptitude and acceptance which is a bridge between our traditional knowledge, ancient civilization and modern progress.

Today i.e. September 14, 1949, the Constitution Sabha accepted Hindi as the king language of the Sangh. Hindi Day is observed on September 14 every year after 1953 to prevent the use of Hindi in the premises. There are people of every region, caste and religion in India. The work of maintaining the sense of unity and integrity among them is the Hindi language written in Devnagari script.

Awaz, Indian Institute of Technology, Khadagpur wishes you all a very happy Hindi Day.

text:
Bill Gates had once famously said that if he had to hire from only one Institution in the world, it would be from IITs. If course, this isn't to look down upon talented students from other Institutes but surely there is something that assigns us a sense of credibility everywhere, whether as a District Magistrate in a far-flung village of Manipur or a startup pitch in Bangalore or a resplendent glassdoor cabin in Silicon Valley. But why exactly is that- surely solving a few fundamental problems of PCM wouldn't have been enough?

Every year, IIT Kharagpur bestows the Young Alumni Achiever Award to a set of diverse individuals who harness the true spirit of a Kgpian and an IITian and bring laurels to our Nation. Driven restless by our curiosity in understanding the diagnosis of these high-performing individuals and what imparts them the sense of steel and resolve, we decided to interview them as a part of a series. Yet, this would be no ordinary one for we have, as our readers will observe, ventured far away from the conventional "How does it feel like..." questions.

First-up, we extend our thanks to all those who agreed to speak to us. We had to begin with some one and in this article, we bring to light a former Silver Medalist of our Institute, someone with a PhD from an Ivy-league and currently noted researcher and Co-founder of a startup. Prof Anshumali Srivastava, a literal epitome of the "Indian jugaad" and never-say die spirit, shared with us valuable insights which we have shared below. We hope you enjoy flipping through it and feel inspired to emulate his success, albeit in your own distinct way.
Link: https://awaaziitkgp.com/young-alumni-achiever-award-2023-prof-shrivastava-anshumali/

If course, this isn't to look down upon talented students from other Institutes but surely there is something that assigns us a sense of credibility everywhere, whether as a District Magistrate in a far-flung village of Manipur or a startup pitch in Bangalore or a resplendent glassdoor cabin in Silicon Valley. But why exactly is that- surely solving a few fundamental problems of PCM wouldn't have been enough?

Every year, IIT Kharagpur bestows the Young Alumni Achiever Award to a set of diverse individuals who harness the true spirit of a Kgpian and an IITian and bring laurels to our Nation. Driven restless by our curiosity in understanding the diagnosis of these high-performing individuals and what imparts them the sense of steel and resolve, we decided to interview them as a part of a series. Yet, this would be no ordinary one for we have, as our readers will observe, ventured far away from the conventional "How does it feel like..." questions.

First-up, we extend our thanks to all those who agreed to speak to us. We had to begin with some one and in this article, we bring to light a former Silver Medalist of our Institute, someone with a PhD from an Ivy-league and currently noted researcher and Co-founder of a startup. Prof Anshumali Srivastava, a literal epitome of the "Indian jugaad" and never-say die spirit, shared with us valuable insights which we have shared below. We hope you enjoy flipping through it and feel inspired to emulate his success, albeit in your own distinct way.
Link: https://awaaziitkgp.com/young-alumni-achiever-award-2023-prof-shrivastava-anshumali/

text:
Greetings, Padawans! Have you ever yearned for a galaxy where your voices can resonate across the stars? The desire to have your thoughts heard, to ignite change, no matter how minor it may seem?

Look no further, for we are Awaaz, the Independent Student Media Body of IIT Kharagpur, and we are organizing the Introductory Seminar and seeking to enlist first-year and second-year students. Seize this golden opportunity to join a force that chronicles every aspect of KGP with the noble intention of bringing positive change through the power of enlightening journalism. You can refine your journalistic, creative writing, design skills, cartooning, photography, videography, and web, much like honing one's lightsaber skills.

May the Force guide you to the registration link for the selections: https://forms.gle/N8vQAGETWQKDoUwN8

May the stars align, and we look forward to your presence at the Kalidas Auditorium!
